entry.title: Just FYI
entry.summary: In an email exchange, it was advised that any alteration to a public key must be republished. However, a private key should never be published; only the public key is required for verifying signed messages. Additionally, the email contained a GnuPG command for sending a key to a keyserver. The conversation took place on the bitcoin-dev mailing list and ended with a quote by Serj Tankian stating "MONEY IS OVER!"
